result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

BOND COVERS 22CF254 & 22CF255. Absolute Sobriety. Not to possess or consume alcohol. Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion. No controlled substances without a prescription and only in amount/frequency as prescribed. Not to possess or use drugs without a prescription or drug paraphernalia. Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion. Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. No abusive contact with S.T.C. Curfew between the hours of 10pm and 6am unless for employment. Must complete homeschool workbooks.

CASES: 22CF254 & 22CF255. 2:20 PM Defendant Mckinley Kim Conito in court.  Attorney Donna Burger in court for Mckinley Kim Conito. Attorney David Stilin in court for attorney Benjamin Webster for the State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. Atty Burger addresses ct re bond modification request. State does not object. CT modifies bond. Def must file proof of residence address within 48 hours change of address. 2:29 pm adj.

BOND COVERS 22CF254 & 22CF255. Absolute Sobriety. Not to possess or consume alcohol. Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion. No controlled substances without a prescription and only in amount/frequency as prescribed. Not to possess or use drugs without a prescription or drug paraphernalia. Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion. Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. No abusive contact with S.T.C. Defendant must reside in camper located on mother's property (290th/County Road I). Must be on the property between the hours of 10pm and 6am unless for employment.

BBH 22CF254 & 22CF255:  Atty Burger addresses CT. ADA Webster opposes. Victim addresses ct. CT sets new bond. 
Demand for speedy trial withdrawn. JT set. All motions in limine, witness lists and proposed jury instructions must be filed at least 30 days prior to Final PreTrial.  Dispositive Motions must be filed at least 60 days prior to Final PreTrial and obtain a hearing date from the judicial assistant prior to filing. Bond cont. 9:28 am adj.
